judges: Before Kephaet, C. J., Schaffer, Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern and Barnes, JJ.

opinions.text:
Pee Curiam,
The decree is affirmed at appellants’ cost on the opinion of Judge Baldrige reported at 124 Pa. Superior Ct. 578.
opinions.author: Pee Curiam,

attorneys: Albert J. Williams, County Solicitor, for amicus curiae.
Philip G. Pendleton and E. Wallace Chadwick, for appellants.
John J. Stetser, with him Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, and George W. Keitel, Assistant Deputy Attorney General, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Easby’s Petition.
Argued April 23, 1937.
Before Kephaet, C. J., Schaffer, Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern and Barnes, JJ.
Albert J. Williams, County Solicitor, for amicus curiae.
Philip G. Pendleton and E. Wallace Chadwick, for appellants.
John J. Stetser, with him Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, and George W. Keitel, Assistant Deputy Attorney General, for appellee.
June 25, 1937:
